body.title: DoceboLMS
body.wikitext:
{{Infobox software
| name = Docebo
| logo = 
| developer = Docebo S.p.A.
| latest release version = 7.5
| latest release date = {{start date and age|2018|10|11}}
| latest preview version = 
| latest preview date = 
| programming language = [[PHP]]
| size = 
| genre = [[Learning management system]]
| license = GPL v2.0
| website = {{URL|docebo.com}}
}}

'''Docebo''' is a [[software as a service]] [[learning management system]].<ref name="Silicon">{{cite web|url=http://siliconvalley.corriere.it/2012/03/21/la_nuova_italia_che_avanza_doc/|title=La nuova Italia che avanza: Docebo|publisher=Corriere Della Sera|accessdate=2014-01-23}}</ref><ref name="Open">{{cite web|url=http://barrysampson.com/2009/04/open-source-lms-10-alternatives-to-moodle/|title=10 Alternatives to Moodle|publisher=Open Source|accessdate=2014-01-23}}</ref><ref name="Dynamic">{{cite web|url=http://dynamicinventions.com/docebo|title=Docebo LMS|publisher=Dynamic Inventions|accessdate=2014-01-23|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140220045633/http://dynamicinventions.com/docebo/|archivedate=2014-02-20}}</ref><ref name="Wired">{{cite web|url=http://italianvalley.wired.it/news/2012/02/10/docebo-elearning-cloud-19867.html|title=Docebo spinge l’e-learning nella nuvola|publisher=Wired.IT|accessdate=2014-01-23|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131211111255/http://italianvalley.wired.it/news/2012/02/10/docebo-elearning-cloud-19867.html|archivedate=2013-12-11}}</ref><ref name="Business">{{cite web|url=http://www.businesscommunity.it/m/_Aprile2013/fare/Docebo_trasformare_la_formazione_in_un_servizio.php|title=Docebo: trasformare la formazione in un servizio|publisher=Business Community|accessdate=2014-01-23}}</ref> Established in 2005, Docebo (Latin for "I will teach") offers a learning portal for companies and their employees, partners and customers.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.klass.com/portfolio_page/docebo/|title=Docebo {{!}} Klass Portfolio|work=Klass|access-date=2017-06-12|language=en-US}}</ref> Docebo is compatible with [[Sharable Content Object Reference Model|SCORM]] 1.2 and 2004 as well as [[XAPI (e-learning)|Tin Can]].<ref name="Open"/> Developed by Docebo Srl, the program was originally released under a [[General Public License|GPL]] V. 2.0 license with no licensing costs. The program now operates as a cloud-hosted software as a service platform as well as being third-party compatible. It currently runs version 7.5.<ref name="CVEDetails">{{cite web|url=https://www.docebo.com/knowledge-base/weeklychangelog70/|title=Docebo Weekly Changelog|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=Docebo|accessdate=2017-06-12}}</ref> The company using the platform loads a course, creates a username and password for employees, and tracks the progress of its users.<ref name="Digitali">{{cite web|url=http://blog.indigenidigitali.com/startupid-claudio-erba-di-docebo/|title=Claudio Erba di Docebo|publisher=Indigenidigitali|accessdate=2014-01-23|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140201205501/http://blog.indigenidigitali.com/startupid-claudio-erba-di-docebo/|archivedate=2014-02-01}}</ref> Docebo is available in more than 40 languages.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://www.trainingindustry.com/suppliers/d/docebo.aspx|title=Docebo - Supplier Profile {{!}} Training Industry|website=www.trainingindustry.com|language=en|access-date=2017-06-12}}</ref> While the primary users of Docebo are midsized companies, it is also assessable for large companies and [[Small and medium enterprises|SMEs]].<ref name="Digitali"/><ref name="Repubblica">{{cite web|url=http://www.repubblica.it/economia/affari-e-finanza/2013/09/30/news/docebo_come_vendere_le-learning_agli_americani-67555597/|title=Docebo come vendere l’e-learning agli americani|publisher=Economia & Finanza|accessdate=2014-01-23}}</ref><ref name="Economy">{{cite web|url=http://www.economyup.it/innovazione/390_docebo-l-e-learning-made-in-italy-che-viaggia-nel-mondo.htm|title=Docebo, l'e-learning made in Italy che viaggia nel mondo|publisher=EconomyUP|accessdate=2014-01-23}}</ref> Docebo also has their platform being used for external enterprise training.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.docebo.com/enterprise-lms-corporate-learning-management-system/|title=Extended Enterprise LMS {{!}} AI Enterprise Learning Management System|work=Docebo|access-date=2018-10-24|language=en-US}}</ref>

In October 2018<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.docebo.com/press/docebo-launches-artificial-intelligence/|title=Docebo 7.5 Debuts Artificial Intelligence Sparking The Future Of Enterprise Learning - Docebo|work=Docebo|access-date=2018-10-24|language=en-US}}</ref>, Docebo released their learning-specific artificial intelligence algorithms into the learning platform that are powered by a combination of machine learning, deep learning and natural language processing to produce an automated and holistic approach to learning (formal LMS, experiential and social) that drives growth, organizational performance, and revenue.
== Product ==
With Docebo Learn (LMS)<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.docebo.com/learning-management-system-lms/|title=Learning Management System (LMS) - Docebo AI Learning Platform|work=Docebo|access-date=2018-10-24|language=en-US}}</ref>, enterprises have the ability to centralize and organize courses, distribute and manage online and instructor-led courses, track certifications and measure results with dashboards and custom analytics. Docebo Learn (LMS) is powered by AI, automatically tagging learning content and making it easier to find.

Docebo also provides accompanying modules to Docebo Learn include Docebo Coach & Share<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.docebo.com/corporate-lms-formal-informal-social-learning/|title=Coach & Share – Docebo AI Social Learning Platform|work=Docebo|access-date=2018-10-24|language=en-US}}</ref> (AI Powered Social Learning)''',''' enabling learning in the flow of work with informal and experiential learning opportunities and Docebo Perform<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.docebo.com/perform-skills-management-system/|title=Docebo Perform: A skills management system to identify and close skill gaps|work=Docebo|access-date=2018-10-24|language=en-US|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181024192335/https://www.docebo.com/perform-skills-management-system/|archive-date=2018-10-24|url-status=dead}}</ref> (skills gap management), helping organizations empower their people through skills gap analysis and improving employee competencies with targeted learning programs based on the current and future skills need of your business.

==History==

Docebo was founded in 2005 by Claudio Erba, who continues to lead the company as CEO.<ref name="Silicon"/><ref name="Repubblica"/> Erba had previously been working at the [[University of Florence]] as a [[information technology consulting|computer consultant]] when a customer asked for a storage solution for teaching material.<ref name="Lastampa">{{cite web|url=http://www.lastampa.it/2013/09/23/tecnologia/docebo-con-il-cloud-elearning-rivoluziona-il-mercato-della-formazione-aziendale-online-I7ZcrY72RtmCgNiNOITtgN/pagina.html|title=Docebo con il "Cloud E-Learning" rivoluziona il mercato della formazione aziendale online|publisher=La Stampa|accessdate=2014-01-23}}</ref> The storage solution evolved into what is now Docebo.<ref name="Lastampa"/>

In 2012, Docebo received its first round of funding from Italian venture capital firm Principia SGR.<ref name="Wired"/><ref name="Repubblica"/> Later that same year, Docebo opened an office in Athens, Georgia.<ref name="Repubblica"/><ref name="Lastampa"/>

Docebo's second venture-backed financing round came from Canadian firm Klass Capital in 2016, funding its continued North American expansion with the opening of an office in Toronto, Ontario.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://techvibes.com/2015/02/12/klass-capital-docebo-2015-02-12|title=E-Learning Platform Raises $3 Million from Toronto VC Firm to Enter Canadian Market|website=Techvibes|access-date=2017-06-12}}</ref>

Most recently Docebo announced it was filing a preliminary prospectus for an Initial Public Offering in Canada.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.newswire.ca/news-releases/docebo-files-preliminary-prospectus-for-initial-public-offering-820171828.html|title=EDocebo Files Preliminary Prospectus for Initial Public Offering|website=newswire.ca|access-date=2018-08-12}}</ref>

== References ==
{{reflist}}

==External links==
* {{Official website|http://www.docebo.com/}}

[[Category:Virtual learning environments]]
[[Category:Learning management systems]]
